document.booking_confirmation_message: Thank you for purchasing your pass to UnWined by The Blend Community! Get ready to sip, swirl, and savor the world's finest wines on 22nd and 23rd June at Pebbles, Bangalore. Remember to bring your ticket and ID for entry. Let the future speak wine! See you there!
document.cancellation_policy:
Terms and Conditions:


1. Entry: Valid ticket required; keep your wine glass throughout; entry between 11am – 10pm on 22nd - 23rd June.

2. Age Restrictions: Must be 21+ with valid ID for wine tastings.

3. Coupon Use: Each coupon valid for one tasting; non-transferable and non-redeemable for cash.

4. Conduct: Organizers may refuse entry or remove intoxicated/inappropriate attendees; drink responsibly.

5. Purchases: Additional wines and foods available at special prices; pay directly at counters.

6. Personal Belongings: Organizers not liable for loss, damage, or theft of personal items.

7. Cancellations and Refunds: Tickets non-refundable; full refund if event is canceled by organizers.

8. Photography and Media: Attendees consent to being photographed/filmed for promotional use.

9. Liability: Organizers not responsible for any injuries, accidents, or damages during the event.


By purchasing a ticket, attendees agree to these terms and conditions. Enjoy UnWined responsibly and let the future speak wine!

document.name: Unwine'd - Wine Festival
document.short_description:
Unwine'd by The Blend Community


Date: 22nd - 23rd June  

Timings: 11am – 10pm  

Venue: Pebbles, Bangalore   


Pouring Over the Details: 

Join us for Unwine'd, an exclusive wine festival in Bangalore that promises an immersive experience with multiple wines from across the globe. Delight in unique wine styles, regional offerings, and exquisite gourmet food pairings. This vibrant event is filled with themed activities, fun games, and live entertainment. Each attendee receives a beautiful wine glass souvenir and tasting coupons for all showcased wines. Engage with fellow wine enthusiasts, partake in educational workshops, and create unforgettable memories.


Highlights:

- Wine Tastings: Sample a diverse range of wines from local and international vineyards.

- Gourmet Pairings: Enjoy artisanal cheeses, chocolates, and gourmet foods.

- Live Music: Dance and relax to foot-tapping music.

- Workshops & Seminars: Learn from wine experts in engaging sessions.

- Artisanal Crafts: Explore handcrafted goods and wine accessories.

- Relaxation Zones: Unwind in scenic, comfortable seating areas.


Special Experiences:

- Grape Stomping: Channel your inner winemaker.

- DIY Wine Cocktails: Create custom wine-based drinks.

- Celebrity Chef's Tables: Enjoy culinary journeys with renowned chefs.

- Wine Blending: Craft your unique wine blend.


Join us at Unwine'd for a celebration of wine, culture, and community. Let the future speak wine!

document.name: Pasta Shop with Chef Goku

custom_questions.question: Number of vegetarians in the group?
Number of non-vegetarians in the group?

document.short_description:
Pasta Shop at The Conservatory!


Our glasshouse is transforming into a pasta shop for just two days. Experience pastas like never before from our menu featuring different types of handcrafted pastas curated by Chef Goku.


Chef Goku is a graduate of The Culinary Institute of America. He has worked at Dominique Ansel Bakery, Aureole, The Clock Tower, Junoon, Rezdora in New York, and Blackbird in Chicago. Currently, he conducts pop-ups and curated dinners in Chennai under the brand name Hygge By Chef Goku. Additionally, he oversees the pastry kitchens Chokolat Culture and Maison Indulgence.


MENU FOR THE PASTA SHOP


ANTIPASTI

 

Stracciatella Incontra Togo (Rs. 490)

Stracciatella Cheese, Togo Tomatoes, Heirloom Cherry Tomato Confit, Basil Oil, BalsamicReduction, Orange wedges, Arugula Served with Fett’ Unta.

 

Cacio E Pepe Wedge Salad  (Rs. 420)

Lettuce Wedge, Pecorino Dressing, Cracked Black Pepper.

 

Passatelli In Brodo (Rs. 420)

Parmesan Broth, Passatelli, White Truffle Oil, Cracked Black Pepper.

  

PASTA 

 

Tagliatelle Al Ragu (Rs. 770)

From Modena (Chef’s Special Short Rib Ragu).

 

Garganelli Al Ragu (Rs. 700) (V)

From Napoli (Chef’s Special Neapolitan Mushroom Ragu).

 

Strozzapreti (Rs. 665)

Creamy Tuscan Sauce with Chicken and Sun-Dried Tomato.

 

Anolini Di Parma (Rs. 770)

Traditional Lamb Meat Filling with Parmigiano Reggiano Sauce, Balsamic Reduction.

 

Ode To Rezdora (Rs. 700) (V)

Cappelletti Verde With Roasted, Sauteed Leeks and Black Mushroom Puree.

 

Agnolotti (Rs. 665) (V)

Agnolotti, Mixed Vegetables, Manchego, Brown Butter, Pumpkin.

 

Tortelli Di Parma (Rs. 665) (V)

Ricotta, Spinach, Herbs, Sun-Dried Tomato, Parmigiano Reggiano, Butter. 

 

Lobster Head Bisque  (Rs. 770)

Linguine, Lobster head Bisque sauce, Grilled Shrimp, Banana pepper.

 

Spring Gnocchi (Rs. 700) (V)

Peas, Asparagus Coins, Sage, Butter, Parmigiano Reggiano, Lemon Zest.

 

DOLCI 

 

Tipsy Tiramisu (Rs. 490)

Tipsy For two, better for one

 

Torta D’ Oliva (Rs. 560)

Olive Oil Cake with Stracciatella Ice Cream

 

Risotto Rice Pannacotta (Rs. 490)

Textures of Mango


Terms and Conditions:

  • The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an event.
  • Do not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.
  • Each slot, lasting 2 hours only, requires attendance at the booked time, with no accommodation for attendance at any other slot except the one booked.
  • No-shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.
  • Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.
  • The schedule is subject to change in case of an emergency or any event out of our control.
  • Children over 7 years of age require a ticket.
  • Children below the age of 7 are not allowed.
  • No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.
  • Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.
  • Paid Valet Parking at Rs. 200 per car.
  • The holder of this ticket grants organizers the right to use, in perpetuity, all or any part of the recording of any video or still footage made of the holder's appearance on any channel without any further approval of theirs.

document.name: Screening: The Notebook | Movie Under the Stars
document.short_description:
Open-air screening experience with popcorn & a three-course dinner by Brik Oven


About the movie


"The Notebook" is a romantic drama film based on Nicholas Sparks' novel of the same name. The story is set in the 1940s and revolves around a passionate love affair between Noah Calhoun, a poor but spirited young man, and Allie Hamilton, a wealthy young woman. Despite their different social backgrounds and the objections of Allie's parents, Noah and Allie fall deeply in love during a summer romance.


3-Course Menu:

Course 1

Mozzarella fritta (V) OR Chicken nuggets (NV)


COURSE 2

3 slices of a large pizza - the farm (V) OR 3 slices of BBQ chicken pizza (NV)


COURSE 3

Lemon ricotta cake 


﻿Terms and Conditions:


  1. The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.
  2. No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.
  3. Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.
  4. Children above the age of 3 need a ticket to attend the event.
  5. Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.
  6. Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.
  7. Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.
  8. In case of rain or other unforeseen conditions, the event will be moved indoors.

document.name: Chefs Rhea Aaron & Tushar Sood | Xacuti and Chill | Double Trouble

custom_questions.question: Pick one for course 5- (Pork) Vindaloo OR (B**f) Steak Recheado?

document.short_description:
Xacuti & Chill with Chefs Rhea Aaron & Tushar Sood


Tasting Menu

Date: June 14, 2024

Time: 7:30 PM to 10 PM


Through this Goan-ishhh meal, the chefs are offering a progressive and creative twist on comforting Goan cuisine, known for its rich flavors and coastal influences. They are helping us make up for all the Goa trips that never made it out of the group chat.


Xacuti & Chill                    


Amuse

Oyster & Balchao


1st Course

Ros Omelette 

Egg, Xacuti, Pulled Chicken, Mini Poee & Pico De gallo 


2nd Course

Crudo

Scallop, Kokum-Ponzu dressing, Furikake spiked Kismoor, Caldine sauce, Prawn chilli crisp & Fresh Jalapeno


3rd Course

Puff Puff Pass 

Beef Roast, Sour cream, Curry leaf, Orange juice pickled slaw & Gravy 


4th Course

Gambas & Choriz Moçambique 

Podi dusted Prawns, Choriz Chilli fry, Confit Garlic & Dill-Caper aioli served with Choriz Fat Brioche


Mains

Vindaloo Royale 

Slow Cooked Pork Shoulder, Crispy Okra, Bacon-Scallion Verde, Vindaloo Veloute with Pine nut & Brown butter Rice 


OR


Steak Recheado 

Recheado butter basted Filet Mignon, Vichyssoise espuma, Drumstick, Concentrated Tomato Confit, Pickled Enoki & Cilantro oil 

 

Dessert 

Pasteis De Nata 

Ulo Vanilla Bean Ice Cream & Apple Crumble 


Come with an appetite!

document.short_description:
It's Just Brunch with Chefs Gautam & Aarohi Sanghavi


East meets West in the Conservatory kitchen as we bring together our love for ALL THINGS BRUNCH!

Eggs, meat, bread, crepes and more...


That’s it!

Don’t ask what the inspiration is, just come hungry for some delicious and heartfelt food! 


Course 1

Miso and Caramel Eggplant Galette with Rocket


Course 2

Pho with Crepe Noodles, Pawns, Fish Balls and Fresh Shiitake


Course 3

Smoked Pork Pickle and Labneh with Foccacia


Course 4

Bresaola with œuf Cocotte and Sourdough


Course 5

Chorizo French Toast with Honey and Ice-cream

document.name: Chefs Karan Upmanyu & Ria Belliappa | Fruits & Vegetables | Double Trouble
document.short_description:
Fruits & Vegetables with Chefs Ria Beliappa & Karan Upmanyu


To celebrate The Conservatory, which has fostered experimentation and creative expression through food for the last two years, we bring you another unconventional dining experience.


Taking inspiration from its botanical setting, modelled after the Lal Bagh greenhouse, this menu plays with the forms and flavours of fruits and vegetables.

 

In our daily lives we use vegetables for savoury dishes, and focus on fruits for sweeter things. This menu aims to challenge that status quo in a fun and playful manner - fruits for dinner and vegetables for dessert!


“Contra la Corriente”


FRUITS & VEGETABLES


FRUITS 


Cherry & Bitter Orange

Loafer’s Seedy Sour Cherry Mostarda, Bitter Orange & Cinnamon Butter


Melon 

Serrano Ham, Melon & Sherry Jelly. 


Mango 

Red Snapper Ceviche, Pickled Mangoes, Mango Leche de Tigre. 


Passion Fruit 

Squid & Prawn, Green Chilli - Passion Fruit Emulsion.


Pineapple

Koji glazed Pork Belly, Pineapple Salsa. 


Apricots, Preserved Lemons & Dates

Lamb Tagine Roulade, Whipped Feta & Braised Fennel. 



VEGETABLES 


Cauliflower

Dulce de Leche, Dill & Walnut. 


Potato 

Chocolate, Bay Leaf, Thyme & Orange 


Beetroot

Caramel, Hazelnut & Brownie. 


Terms and Conditions :

document.name: Chefs Dina Weber & Brehadeesh Kumar | Arubaito Ranchi - ‘Workers Lunch’   | Double Trouble
document.short_description:
Menu


Poor knight

German milk soaked bun, usually made from stale bread, fried, served with apple relish


Puffer

Farmer and worker lunch that became winter street food, grated potato fritter, served with sour cream and anchovy 


Yakionigiri

Staple Japanese working breakfast. Grilled ball of rice, stuffed with pork an caramelised onions and covered in nori


Smoked salmon sashimi with Meerrettich 

Smoked salmon,Meerrettich (German white radish paste), potesara (German Japanese potato salad), Spargel (pickled asparagus)


Maultasche and dashi 

Pork mince, wrapped in pasta sheet, mackerel bone dashi, black garlic oil māyu


Aji fry and soba schwarzplentene

South German buckwheat dumpling, shiso milk bechamel and panko fried horse mackerel


Matcha Baumkuchen 

German crepe cake (symbolising annual rings of trees) with matcha and white chocolate, black current gel and yoghurt mousse 


Terms and Conditions :

  • The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an event
  • No food preferences and allergies can be accommodated for this meal.

document.cancellation_policy:
Ticket Purchase and Entry:

• Tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable.

• Entry is only permitted with a valid ticket and government-issued photo ID.

• The ticket holder must be of legal drinking age (21 years and above).


Event Timing:

• The event starts at 3 pm and ends at closing time.

• The venue has the right to charge a cover amount over and above the ticket amount for entry beyond 8 pm.


Conduct:

• The venue reserves the right to refuse entry to anyone found to be violating venue policies or behaving inappropriately.


Age Restrictions:

• The venue reserves the right to refuse entry to anyone based on their age restriction policy. 


Safety and Security:

• All guests may be subject to security checks upon entry.

• The venue is not responsible for the loss or theft of personal belongings.


Photography and Recording:

• The event may be photographed and recorded by the organizers for promotional purposes.


Alcohol Consumption:

• Alcohol will be served only to individuals who are 21 years or older.

• The venue reserves the right to refuse service to anyone deemed intoxicated or behaving inappropriately.


Cancellation and Changes:

• The organizers reserve the right to cancel or reschedule the event in case of unforeseen circumstances.

• In the event of cancellation, a full refund will be issued to ticket holders.


Liability:

• The organizers and the venue are not liable for any injuries, damages, or losses that occur during the event.


Miscellaneous:

• By purchasing a ticket, the ticket holder agrees to these terms and conditions.

• The terms and conditions are subject to change at the discretion of the organizers.

document.name: OTJF TURNS 5
document.short_description:
For "OTJF Turns 5”, we’re putting together a line-up of some of our favourite people who’ve contributed to unforgettable moments at our gigs. Join us this Sunday, 23rd June 2024, at Indiranagar Social, Bangalore, as we celebrate five incredible years of OTJF! Here’s what’s in store:


We start off with Spotlight: A Film showcase + OST Spotlight + Quiz of Empire Records (1995), a cult classic comedy-drama about a group of quirky employees at an independent record store navigating personal dilemmas and rebellious antics curated by the lovely Boo! Ya Watchin?.


Our music line-up includes DJ Uri, Digging in India, Maddwax, and Raka Ashok to celebrate at Indiranagar Social. 


Since it’s World Music Month, Digging In India and French DJ, Maddwax are digging deep into their crates to bring us the finest Indian disco, Arabic funk, Ghanian Highlife, Ethiopian jazz, Libyan Reggae and much more! And as our birthday also coincides with Juneteenth (June 19), we’re getting DJs Raka Ashok and Uri on the decks to close out the night with some of the best Hip-Hop in the game.


And finally, we’re also setting up a room full of wax from all over the world, along with some very special accessories and limited edition merch all at great prices! Come through, hang with us, and help us celebrate 5 years as India’s freshest record store!

Entry to the event and all its dedicated rooms
Access to the film screening (Limited seats - so first come, first serve)

Any other items on sale

document.name: 'Spirited Away' Movie Screening | Family Movie Night
document.short_description:
Family Movie Night: World Cinema for Kids!


Join us as we watch a series of carefully curated rare masterpieces from around the world, made just for kids. Watch this while cozying up with your family at the studio.


"Spirited Away" is a Japanese animated fantasy film written and directed by Hayao Miyazaki, produced by Studio Ghibli, and released in 2001. The story follows a 10-year-old girl named Chihiro Ogino who becomes trapped in a mysterious and magical world of spirits while moving to a new neighborhood.


Event Highlights

Broaden Horizons with Global Tales: Dive into diverse artistic expressions through rare masterpieces curated for children. Cultivate Cultural Curiosity: Spark interest in world cinema and inspire exploration of different cultures through film's enchantment. Quality Family Bonding: Embark on a cinematic journey to a new country each month, forging lasting memories and strengthening family connections.


Why Attend?

Uncover Hidden Treasures: Discover lesser-known gems handpicked for their artistic brilliance and captivating storytelling. Artistic Excellence: Immerse your child in films of unparalleled artistic merit, fueling their imagination and creativity. Safe Family Environment: Enjoy movies in a secure, family-friendly setting, ensuring a worry-free experience for kids and parents alike.


Don't miss this opportunity to create lasting memories with your family while exposing your kids to the wonders of world cinema. Join us for Family Movie Night – where the magic of storytelling knows no bounds!


Terms and Conditions:

  • The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.

  • If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.
  • Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.
  • The movie will take place in the studio

document.name: Wine Tasting: Fratelli Master Selection Wines & Cheese
document.short_description:
Bangalore wine lovers! How does a Saturday evening filled with delicious wines, cheese and fascinating wine stories with a fun wine community sound like? Just perfect -- join Sommelier Devati Mallick (Founder: Drink With D) at Swwing, Indiranagar to discover the fabulous new Master Selection range by Fratelli Wines. Did you know they do vineyard-inspired artisanal cheese too? Come taste them with us!


3 new wines in a brand-new look, 3 styles of vineyard-inspired cheese, and fun storytelling on what inspired this range by Fratelli + chatting on all things wine! A short, fascinating, delicious wine & cheese tasting experience- the perfect pre-dinner plans to level up your Saturday night!

Limited seats only, grab a spot now! Early bird tickets at just INR 1,000!


Here's what you'll taste:

Wines

  • Fratelli Master Selection White
  • Fratelli Master Selection Rosé
  • Fratelli Master Selection Red

Cheese

  • Chenin-rinsed Sunburst
  • Syrah-rinsed Gusto
  • Sangiovese leaf-aged Cheddarg

default_section.text:
90ml tasting portions of 3 wines selected for the evening
Cheese boards by Fratelli & Swwing
An evening of fun, experiential learning on wines
